content:
I'm glad to hear that your stay at the Hilton in downtown Chicago was great overall! Sorry to hear that the bed was a bit too firm, though. Hilton beds can vary from property to property, so it's always a good idea to check the hotel's website or contact them directly to ask about their bed types and comfort levels.

If you do end up choosing the Hilton Times Square, you might want to consider requesting a room on a higher floor or a room that faces away from Times Square if you're concerned about the noise and crowds. The hotel's staff is usually happy to accommodate special requests, and it might make a big difference in your stay.

On the other hand, if you're looking for a more laid-back atmosphere, the Hilton Midtown or one of the other options I mentioned might be a better fit. It's always a good idea to research and read reviews from other travelers to get a sense of what to expect from a hotel.

Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
